00020 /** \file
00021  \brief Dump a single value in a db as height in a KML document
00022  */
00023 
00024 
00025 #include <stdlib.h>
00026 #include <stdio.h>
00027 #include <math.h>
00028 #include <time.h>
00029 
00030 #include "singleheight.h"
00031 
00032 #include "sqlite3.h"
00033 
00034 /// A distance greater than this is considered to be not zero
00035 #define EPSILONDIST 0.000001
00036 
00037 void kmlvalueheight(sqlite3 *db, FILE *f, const char *name, const char *desc, const char *columnname, int height, int defaultvis, double start, double end, int trip) {
00038     int rc; // return from sqlite
00039     sqlite3_stmt *stmt; // sqlite statement
00040     const char *dbend; // ignored handle for sqlite
00041 
00042     // For normalising the data
00043     float normalfactor = 1;
00044     sqlite3_stmt *normal_stmt;
00045     char normal_sql[1024];
00046     
00047     snprintf(normal_sql, sizeof(normal_sql),
00048             "SELECT %i/(SELECT MAX(%s) FROM obd WHERE trip=%i)",
00049             height, columnname, trip
00050             );
00051     rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, normal_sql, -1, &normal_stmt, &dbend);
00052     if(SQLITE_OK != rc) {
00053         printf("SQL Error in valueheight: %i, %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00054         printf("SQL: %s\n", normal_sql);
00055         return;
00056     } else {
00057         if(SQLITE_ROW != sqlite3_step(normal_stmt)) {
00058             printf("SQL Error stepping: %i, %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00059             printf("SQL: %s\n", normal_sql);
00060             return;
00061         }
00062         normalfactor=sqlite3_column_double(normal_stmt, 0);
00063     }
00064     sqlite3_finalize(normal_stmt);
00065     
00066     // And the actual output
00067     char select_sql[2048]; // the select statement
00068 
00069     snprintf(select_sql,sizeof(select_sql),
00070                     "SELECT T1.obdkmlthing AS height,gps.lat,gps.lon "
00071                     "FROM (SELECT %s AS obdkmlthing,time FROM obd WHERE trip=%i) AS T1 "
00072                     "INNER JOIN gps "
00073                     "ON T1.time=gps.time "
00074                     "WHERE gps.trip=%i ",
00075                     columnname, trip, trip);
00076 
00077     rc = sqlite3_prepare_v2(db, select_sql, -1, &stmt, &dbend);
00078 
00079     if(SQLITE_OK != rc) {
00080         printf("SQL Error in valueheight: %i, %s\n", rc, sqlite3_errmsg(db));
00081         printf("SQL: %s\n", select_sql);
00082         return;
00083     } else {
00084 
00085         fprintf(f,
00086             "<Document>\n"
00087             "<Style>\n"
00088             "<ListStyle><listItemType>checkHideChildren</listItemType></ListStyle>\n"
00089             "</Style>\n"
00090             "<visibility>%i</visibility>\n"
00091             "<name>%s</name>\n"
00092             "<description>%s</description>\n",defaultvis,name,desc);
00093 
00094         fprintf(f,"<Placemark>\n"
00095             "<name>chart</name>\n"
00096             "<LineString>\n"
00097             "<extrude>1</extrude>\n"
00098             "<tessellate>1</tessellate>\n"
00099             "<altitudeMode>relativeToGround</altitudeMode>\n"
00100             "<coordinates>");
00101 
00102         int ismoving=1; // Set when the car is moving
00103 
00104         int have_firstpos = 0;
00105         double firstpos[3] = {0,0,0};
00106         double lastpos[3] = {0,0,0};
00107 
00108         // Number of rows, total
00109         long rowcount = 0;
00110         // Number of rows output to kml
00111         long outputcount = 0;
00112 
00113         double totalheight = 0;
00114         while(SQLITE_ROW == sqlite3_step(stmt)) {
00115             rowcount++;
00116 
00117             if(0 == have_firstpos) {
00118                 firstpos[2] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 2);
00119                 firstpos[1] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 1);
00120                 firstpos[0] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 0);
00121                 have_firstpos = 1;
00122             }
00123 
00124             double currpos[3];
00125             currpos[2] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 2);
00126             currpos[1] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 1);
00127             currpos[0] = sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 0);
00128 
00129             float delta = sqrt((currpos[2] - lastpos[2]) * (currpos[2] - lastpos[2]) +
00130                     (currpos[1] - lastpos[1]) * (currpos[1] - lastpos[1]));
00131             float height = normalfactor * sqlite3_column_double(stmt, 0);
00132             if(delta > EPSILONDIST) {
00133                 ismoving = 1;
00134             }
00135             if(ismoving) {
00136                 outputcount++;
00137                 fprintf(f, "%f,%f,%f\n", currpos[2],currpos[1],height);
00138                 totalheight += height;
00139             }
00140             if(delta < EPSILONDIST) {
00141                 ismoving = 0;
00142             }
00143 
00144             lastpos[2] = currpos[2];
00145             lastpos[1] = currpos[1];
00146             lastpos[0] = currpos[0];
00147 
00148         }
00149 
00150         printf("Total db rows: %li. KML rows: %li. Ignored rows: %li %s\n", rowcount, outputcount,
00151                         rowcount - outputcount,
00152                         outputcount<(rowcount-outputcount)?"\nOutput rows seems low":"");
00153         fprintf(f,"</coordinates>\n"
00154             "</LineString>\n"
00155             "</Placemark>\n");
00156 
00157         // Now print start and end beacons
00158         time_t endt = (time_t)floor(end);
00159         time_t startt = (time_t)floor(start);
00160 
00161         fprintf(f, "<Placemark>\n"
00162             "<name>Start %i (%s)</name>\n"
00163             "<Point>\n"
00164             "<coordinates>\n"
00165             "%f,%f,%f"
00166             "</coordinates>\n"
00167             "</Point>\n"
00168             "</Placemark>\n", trip, ctime(&startt),
00169                 firstpos[2],firstpos[1],firstpos[0]);
00170 
00171         fprintf(f, "<Placemark>\n"
00172             "<name>End %i (%s)</name>\n"
00173             "<Point>\n"
00174             "<coordinates>\n"
00175             "%f,%f,%f"
00176             "</coordinates>\n"
00177             "</Point>\n"
00178             "</Placemark>\n", trip, ctime(&endt),
00179                 lastpos[2],lastpos[1],lastpos[0]);
00180 
00181         fprintf(f,"</Document>\n");
00182     }
00183 
00184     sqlite3_finalize(stmt);
00185 }
